p: As a poikilothermic ectotherm, B. tabaci is unable to regulate its own body temperature and is influenced by environmental temperature, and is therefore susceptible to chilling injury as a result of low temperature exposure [ 40]. Chilling injury often involves the reduction and loss of membrane, organelle and enzyme function, and other processes, which in turn reduce the survival and performance of sub-lethal characteristics of the organism concerned [ 41â€“ 43].
